history.proof: intros x. qsimpl time: 1. sauto lq: on dep: on depth: 3.

exceptions.exn: Abstracting over the terms "n" and "x" leads to a term fun (n0 : nat) (x0 : Terms n0) => let nilTermsHelp0 := fun (n1 : nat) (H : n1 = n0) => nat_rec (fun n2 : nat => n2 = n0 -> Terms n2) (fun _ : n0 = n0 => Tnil) (fun (n2 : nat) (_ : n2 = n0 -> Terms n2) (H0 : S n2 = n0) => let H1 : False := eq_ind (S n2) (fun e : nat => match e with | 0 => False | S _ => True end) I n0 H0 in False_rec (Terms (S n2)) H1) n1 H in Tnil = x0 which is ill-typed. Reason is: In environment L : Language language_dec : language_decideable n := 0 : nat nilTermsHelp := fun (n0 : nat) (H : n0 = n) => nat_rec (fun n1 : nat => n1 = n -> Terms n1) (fun _ : n = n => Tnil) (fun (n1 : nat) (_ : n1 = n -> Terms n1) (H0 : S n1 = n) => let H1 : False := eq_ind (S n1) (fun e : nat => match e with | 0 => False | S _ => True end) I n H0 in False_rec (Terms (S n1)) H1) n0 H : forall n0 : nat, n0 = n -> Terms n0 x : Terms n n0 : nat x0 : Terms n0 n1 : nat H : n1 = n0 n2 : nat Hrecn : n2 = n0 -> Terms n2 H0 : S n2 = n0 The term "eq_ind (S n2) (fun e : nat => match e with | 0 => False | S _ => True end) I n0 H0" has type "match n0 with | 0 => False | S _ => True end" while it is expected to have type "False".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
L: Language
language_dec: language_decideable
nilTermsHelp: forall n : nat, n = 0 -> Terms n

Goal:
forall x : Terms 0, Tnil = x

Premises:
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
Inductive Term : Set := var : nat -> Term | apply : forall f : Functions L, Terms (arity L (inr f)) -> Term with Terms : nat -> Set := Tnil : Terms 0 | Tcons : forall n : nat, Term -> Terms n -> Terms (S n) Arguments var _%nat_scope Arguments Terms _%nat_scope Arguments Tcons _%nat_scope
Terms_rec : forall P : forall n : nat, Terms n -> Set, P 0 Tnil -> (forall (n : nat) (t : Term) (t0 : Terms n), P n t0 -> P (S n) (Tcons n t t0)) -> forall (n : nat) (t : Terms n), P n t
Terms_rect : forall P : forall n : nat, Terms n -> Type, P 0 Tnil -> (forall (n : nat) (t : Term) (t0 : Terms n), P n t0 -> P (S n) (Tcons n t t0)) -> forall (n : nat) (t : Terms n), P n t
Terms_ind : forall P : forall n : nat, Terms n -> Prop, P 0 Tnil -> (forall (n : nat) (t : Term) (t0 : Terms n), P n t0 -> P (S n) (Tcons n t t0)) -> forall (n : nat) (t : Terms n), P n t
Terms_sind : forall P : forall n : nat, Terms n -> SProp, P 0 Tnil -> (forall (n : nat) (t : Term) (t0 : Terms n), P n t0 -> P (S n) (Tcons n t t0)) -> forall (n : nat) (t : Terms n), P n t
Inductive Term : Set := var : nat -> Term | apply : forall f : Functions L, Terms (arity L (inr f)) -> Term with Terms : nat -> Set := Tnil : Terms 0 | Tcons : forall n : nat, Term -> Terms n -> Terms (S n) Arguments var _%nat_scope Arguments Terms _%nat_scope Arguments Tcons _%nat_scope
Terms_Term_rec_full : forall (P : Term -> Set) (P0 : forall n : nat, Terms n -> Set), (forall n : nat, P (var n)) -> (forall (f0 : Functions L) (t : Terms (arity L (inr f0))), P0 (arity L (inr f0)) t -> P (apply f0 t)) -> P0 0 Tnil -> (forall (n : nat) (t : Term), P t -> forall t0 : Terms n, P0 n t0 -> P0 (S n) (Tcons n t t0)) -> forall (n : nat) (t : Terms n), P0 n t
Terms_Term_ind : forall (P : Term -> Prop) (P0 : forall n : nat, Terms n -> Prop), (forall n : nat, P (var n)) -> (forall (f0 : Functions L) (t : Terms (arity L (inr f0))), P0 (arity L (inr f0)) t -> P (apply f0 t)) -> P0 0 Tnil -> (forall (n : nat) (t : Term), P t -> forall t0 : Terms n, P0 n t0 -> P0 (S n) (Tcons n t t0)) -> forall (n : nat) (t : Terms n), P0 n t

Term_Terms_rec_full : forall (P : Term -> Set) (P0 : forall n : nat, Terms n -> Set), (forall n : nat, P (var n)) -> (forall (f0 : Functions L) (t : Terms (arity L (inr f0))), P0 (arity L (inr f0)) t -> P (apply f0 t)) -> P0 0 Tnil -> (forall (n : nat) (t : Term), P t -> forall t0 : Terms n, P0 n t0 -> P0 (S n) (Tcons n t t0)) -> forall t : Term, P t
